summary: Azithromycin is an antibiotic that treats various bacterial infections like ear infections, strep throat, and pneumonia. It can also be used for malaria when combined with other drugs. You can take it by mouth, intravenously, or as eye drops. Common side effects include nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. Serious side effects are rare but can include allergic reactions and a specific type of diarrhea. Azithromycin was discovered in Croatia and is considered a vital medicine by the World Health Organization. It's widely available and was the 78th most prescribed medication in the U.S. in 2022.
title: Azithromycin
